conversation.content: So I got this... what's the word... invoice? Bill. My liability went up. Way up.
Okay okay, let me—let me pull that up for you right away, um, can I get your policy number? It should start with TL and then...
TL-4-8-2-9. I'm probably missing something obvious here.

Got it got it, TL-4829, perfect, and I see here you're listed as a tree service professional, policy active since March 2022, and your premium just renewed on December 1st at... oh. That's quite a jump.
Yeah. Eight hundred more. Per month. So basically I'm just... confused.
Right right, I'm seeing it went from $485 to $1,285 monthly, that's—that's a significant increase, let me check check if there's any claims or incidents that might have triggered this adjustment.
There's nothing. No claims. I haven't done anything wrong. Have I?
No no no, you're absolutely right, zero claims filed, perfect record actually, five-star safety rating as of November 15th, so this isn't about anything you did, let me dig deeper into what caused...
Maybe I forgot to file something? Update something?

Actually I—I think I found it, there's a code here, RISK-ADJ-2024-Q4, and it looks like your entire region got reclassified for higher risk after those storms in October, affecting all policies renewed after November 30th.
So it's... not just me then. That's something at least.
Definitely not just you, this affected, um, let me see... 847 commercial policies in your ZIP code area, but I understand that doesn't make the increase any easier to handle.
Is there like a... I don't know. Payment plan? Something?

Yes yes, absolutely, we have—we have several options actually, there's a quarterly payment plan that would break it down to $3,855 every three months instead of monthly, or we could look at adjusting coverage limits to bring the premium down.
The coverage though. Can't really cut that. Tree falls on someone's house...

You're you're absolutely right to be careful about that, your current coverage is $2 million general liability which is—which is standard for your industry, but wait, I'm seeing something else here...
Something good? Or...

Actually yes, there's a safety certification discount code CERT-SAFE-90 that could apply if you have current ISA credentials, that would reduce your premium by 15 percent, bringing it down to about $1,092 monthly.
I do have that. The ISA thing. So basically that would help. A bit.

It would it would, and you know what? Let me also schedule you for a full policy review with our commercial specialist on December 18th at 2:00 PM, they might find additional discounts, because honestly? An increase like this with your perfect record... we should explore every option we have.

scenario: tree trimmer, angry about a liability insurance rate increase with no prior notice
